Seed surface ribbed: the seed surface has ribs running from end to end
Roots: there is approximately one root per thallus
Roots perforating basal scale: there is no basal scale on the plant
Thallus edge: the edge of the thallus is smooth (without teeth) near the tip
Thallus shape: the thallus is obovate (egg-shaped, but with the widest point above the middle of the leaf blade)
Thallus shape in cross-section: the thallus is somewhat flattened on at least one side in cross-section
